attributes.action: when its Foggy please drive with Headlights ON
attributes.additional_details:
Driving in any FOG is difficult, driving at Night in FOG is bad, but luckily most drivers will have their HEADLIGHTS ON, but driving in daylight hours when it is Foggy is even more dangerous especially when the visibility (distance to see a another vehicle in front or approaching) is below 100yards,

Just lately it seems to be common practise for driving in Fog during the day for people to either have NO LIGHTS on, or just their SIDE LIGHTS.

Putting your LIGHTS ON allows people to see YOU.

We need make sure that when it is Foggy that it is the LAW to have your HEADLIGHTS ON and your REAR FOG LIGHT ON, and you have Fog Lights fitted to your vehicle, then these should be switched ON.

Putting your HEADLIGHTS ON, will allow drivers coming in the other direction to see you.

Putting your FOG LIGHTS ON, will allow drivers coming in the other direction to see you.

Putting your REAR RED FOG LIGHT ON, will allow other drivers BEHIND you to see you.
